Package es.udc.redes.webserver

Class HTTPResponse

java.lang.Object
es.udc.redes.webserver.HTTPResponse
public class HTTPResponse
extends java.lang.Object
This class analyzes all the different parameters of the HTTP request and sends the correspond message to the client.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.io.File accessLog
    Accesses Log
    private java.lang.Object accessMutex
    Mutex to control the writes in the 'accessLog.log'.
    private boolean allow
    Bool to allow the client to see the files inside directories.
    private java.lang.String basePath
    Root path of the server.
    private java.text.SimpleDateFormat date
    Date formatter to send responses.
    private java.text.SimpleDateFormat dateLog
    Date formatter to register requests in the logs.
    private java.io.File defaultFile
    Default file to be opened if no one is specified in the request.
    private java.io.File error400
    Error 400 html page
    private java.io.File error403
    Error 403 html page
    private java.io.File error404
    Error 404 html page
    private java.io.File errorLog
    Errors Log
    private java.lang.Object errorMutex
    Mutex to control the writes in the 'errorLog.log'.
    private java.net.Socket socket
    Socket through which we will send the response.
    private long threadId
    Long that identifies the current thread

  • Constructor Details

    • HTTPResponse

      public HTTPResponse​(java.net.Socket s, java.util.Properties properties, java.lang.Object accessMutex, java.lang.Object errorMutex, long threadId)
      Parameters:
      s - Socket through which we will send the response.
      properties - Different server properties specified in 'server.properties' such as the default file or * the default directory.
      accessMutex - Mutex to control the writes in the 'accessLog.log'.
      errorMutex - Mutex to control the writes in the 'errorLog.log'.
      threadId - Id of the current thread.

  • Method Details

    • response

      public void response​(java.lang.String request, java.lang.String ifModSince) throws java.lang.Exception
      Main method which will handle the syntax related analysis of the request, delegating to other functions all the rest.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request line.
      ifModSince - String of the parameter If-Modified-Since; null if there's no one.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - Different exceptions that can occur into all the sub-functions called by this one; mainly I/O Exceptions.

    • sendResponse

      private void sendResponse​(java.lang.String headers, java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException
      Method in charge of sending to the connected client to the socket, the file and the headers passed as an argument.
      Parameters:
      headers - All the headers to send.
      file - File to send; null if no file are going to be sent.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs when sending the response.

    • getHeaders

      private java.lang.String getHeaders​(java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException
      Get all the headers (date, server, last modified, content-type and content-length) for the file passed as an argument
      Parameters:
      file - The file which get the headers.
      Returns:
      String with the headers.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If and I/O error occurs when generating the headers.

    • addAccessToLog

      private void addAccessToLog​(java.lang.String request, java.lang.String accessMessage, java.io.File content) throws java.io.IOException
      Add a correct request to the AccessLog.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request.
      accessMessage - Message sent to the client.
      content - File sent to the client.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs when writing to the log.

    • addErrorToLog

      private void addErrorToLog​(java.lang.String request, java.lang.String errorMessage) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Add an incorrect request to the ErrorLog.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request.
      errorMessage - Message sent to the client.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - If the ErrorLog couldn't be found.

    • badRequest

      private void badRequest​(java.lang.String request) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to handle the Bad requests.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • accessForbidden

      private void accessForbidden​(java.lang.String request) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to handle the Access Forbidden requests.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • notFound

      private void notFound​(java.lang.String request) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to handle the Not Found requests.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • notModified

      private void notModified​(java.lang.String request, java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to handle the Not Modified requests.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request.
      file - The not-modified file.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • requestOK

      private void requestOK​(java.lang.String request, java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to handle the OK requests.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request.
      file - The file requested.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs.

    • modifiedSince

      private void modifiedSince​(java.lang.String request, java.lang.String ifModSince, java.io.File file) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to test if the file was modified since the specified date; it will also send to the client the correspond message based on that comparison.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request.
      ifModSince - The If-Modified-Since header parameter.
      file - File requested.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/0 error occurs while comparing the dates.

    • allowRequest

      private void allowRequest​(java.lang.String request, java.io.File dir) throws java.io.IOException
      Method to process the requests to show a list of the files inside a directory.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request.
      dir - Directory where to look into.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If an I/O exception occurs.

    • dynRequest

      private void dynRequest​(java.lang.String request, java.lang.String lUrl) throws java.lang.Exception
      Method to handle the dynamic requests made by the client.
      Parameters:
      request - HTTP request.
      lUrl - Complete URL.
      Throws:
      java.lang.Exception - If an error occurs while generating the dynamic page.
